intro: Crepis haenseleri, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are hairy and basal, forming a rosette, while its stems are upright and bear the flowering heads. Crepis haenseleri is often found in meadows and open slopes at high altitudes.
